channel.title: My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Hello World with the ESP8266
item.description: The ESP8266 is an affordable WIFI chip which is the answer to pretty much any question like “how do I give this WIFI?”. The chip comes in a variety of modules named esp-XX. The most common ones are from AI-Thinkers but Espressif Systems (the maker of the chip) also have their own. A list of the different modules can be found here. The board in the picture below is the low cost esp-01 module you can buy off ebay for $2 or so, with the antenna, clock, resistors etc already wired up.

item.title: Uploading the Arduino IDE to the ESP8266
Understanding the how the Internet Works
item.description: To understand exactly what I can do with the ESP8266 or any other WIFI module I wanted to get a clearer picture of how the Internet actually works. At the moment, there are a bunch of terms which I only have a fuzzy understanding of (web server, web client, DNS, CNAME, HTTP…) and I’m not sure how all the components of the Internet fit together (what actually is a modem/router?

item.title: Wifi Salt Lamp (Part 1)
item.description: The end goal of this project is to get a working wifi powerboard. As a stepping stone I have started with one power point and am using a salt lamp to test. This post is a write up of what I have done so far, what I learnt, information I used from datasheets and challenges etc… Top Level-ish Schematic The schematic below shows how all the components fits together.

item.title: Taking the derivative of the softmax function
item.description: The softmax funciton assumes that the scores received from a classifier are unnormalized log probabilities. The softmax function is: \begin{align} L_0 = & \max(0, e^1_0 - w_0^Tx_0 + 1) + \max(0, w_2^Tx_0 - w_0^Tx_0 + 1) \\ L_1 = & \max(0, w_0^Tx_1 - w_1^Tx_1 + 1) + \max(0, w_2^Tx_1 - w_1^Tx_1 + 1) \\ L_2 = & \max(0, w_0^Tx_2 - w_2^Tx_2 + 1) + \max(0, w_1^Tx_2 - w_2^Tx_2 + 1) \\
